snippet: Supporters described the case as a combination of flawed or nonexistent evidence, ethnic prejudice and extreme cultural misunderstandings.
abstract: Lawyers for American couple Matthew and Grace Huang, who have been imprisoned in Qatar since 2012 on charges that they starved their adopted 8-year-old daughter with the intent of selling her organs, are scheduled to have the opportunity to present their side of the story for the first time; supporters of the couple describe the case as a combination of flawed or nonexistent evidence, ethnic prejudice and extreme cultural misunderstandings.

byline.contributor: Shabina Khatri contributed reporting from Doha, Qatar.

lead_paragraph: Supporters described the case as a combination of flawed or nonexistent evidence, ethnic prejudice and extreme cultural misunderstandings.

headline.main: Americans Jailed for Months in Qatar After Daughter’s Death
headline.print_headline: Americans Jailed for Months in Qatar After Daughter’s Death
